alert.note: Alert for Spencer (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 01 at 5:08AM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Moderate to Locally Heavy Rainfall may lead to localized flooding Thursday... Moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected to develop ahead of a slow moving Arctic cold front very late Wednesday night into Thursday. Soil conditions remain quite moist across the region ahead of the expected rainfall. The ground will have less capacity to absorb the rain, causing the rain to runoff quicker into ditches, creeks and streams. The colder temperatures expected with the approaching Arctic cold front will also lessen the evaporation of the rainfall. At this time, western Kentucky, especially across parts of the extreme southern sections of the Purchase and Pennyrile region of west Kentucky remain the most vulnerable to rapid rises of water levels in low-lying and poorly drained locations. Some overland flooding may occur, especially in flood prone areas late Thursday. If you live or work in areas especially prone to flooding, stay tuned to the latest forecast and monitor for statements regarding flooding potential in your area.
